summary: The chapel from my long-forgotten castle volkihar mod is making a return in its own dungeon.
descriptionHtml:
[b][i][u]VERSION 0.04[/u][/i][/b]

Added a dining room and kitchen, and improved the lighting throughout.

[b][u][i]VERSION 0.03[/i][/u][/b]

Made some tweaks to the chapel and started working on the paths leading to new rooms and such.
[b][i][u]
VERSION 1,02
[/u][/i][/b]
The chapel has been finished, I'm rather happy with it. There's furniture, decorations and lighting. If anybody's wondering why I have a gargoyle sitting above a statue of mara it's because they are historically creatures of protection, they're not evil or malicious.

EDIT: Oooops, Now with added chandelliers! XD
[b][i][u]
VERSION 0.01[/u][/i][/b]

Uploaded the Chapel, but it's not finished yet, it still needs furniture and decorations etc. Please take a look and let me know if you have any suggestions for or issues with the mod. To get to the cell, open up the console and type coc "Forgotten temple"

[center]*      *      *[/center]
It's been a long time since I decided to refurbish castle volkihar, only to have to stop because it kept causing CTDs no matter how careful I was.

I spent 12 hours making a chapel and had to get rid of it, and people who were looking forward to that mod wanted to know if I had plans to make the chapel a separate room of some kind, and I have finally decided to do so.

The first step will be rebuilding the chapel, which will take some time, especially as i am more busy these days, but I will be uploading step by step so people can beta test this with me.

The plan is to make a lengthy labyrinthine temple, with the chapel as its heart. If people want it to have NPCs and quests and such, then I will need a modder with coding experience to work with me, else it's gonna be empty save for many deadly traps.

For now, the file is stage 0.0 and has nothing in it, I just wanted to create this page. It requires all three expansions because i don't want to be limited in what i can add, so apologies if this is an issue for people.
author: Doozerpindan
